activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James H. Branam

records.addlTxt:
2:48 PM Defendant James H. Branam appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CM388, 18CM426 & 22CF171. PD's office is still searching for counsel. Defendant on revocation hold. adj. 02:49 pM
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James H. Branam does not appear. Calling 18CM388 & 18CM426. Motion filed to reinstitute proceedings. Court statement to Defendant's address. Sowinski states sent notice to jail - Defendant is in custody. Court in recess 10:24 AM. Back on record 10:29 AM Defendant James H. Branam appeared by video, in custody. other parties remain same. Court statement to status of cases - both on a Deferred Judgement - new charges have been filed - motion to reinstate had been filed. Defendant does not dispute motion. Court grants motions - court will enter judgment. Sowinski does not want to go to sentencing - Defendant does not have counsel in new case - would have a global resolution. Defendant states revocation is September 1st - PD's office is still searching for counsel. Sowinski would like other case to transfer to Branch II. Court will allow transfer. Court also calls case 22CF171. Bond continued. 10:39 PM
No contact with victim listed in the complaint

1:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James H. Branam appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Curt questions Defendant on residence./employment. Sowinski statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 01:43 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
